description: Learn features specific to the world's most popular open source database.

slides.title: Storage Engines
slides.content:
# Pluggable Architecture üîå

MySQL allows you to choose how data is stored for each table.

- **InnoDB:** The default. Supports Transactions (ACID), Foreign Keys, and Row-level locking.
- **MyISAM:** Older, fast for reads but no transactions and Table-level locking.

slides.title: AUTO_INCREMENT
slides.content:
# Identifiers üÜî

MySQL's way of generating unique IDs.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
CREATE TABLE users (
    id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50)
);
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: SHOW Commands
slides.content:
# Inspection üïµÔ∏è

MySQL specific commands to see schema info.

- `SHOW DATABASES;`
- `SHOW TABLES;`
- `SHOW CREATE TABLE users;`
- `DESCRIBE users;`

slides.title: LIMIT with Offset
slides.content:
# Pagination Syntax üìÑ

MySQL syntax for paging.

`SELECT * FROM users LIMIT 10 OFFSET 5;`

Or the shorthand:
`SELECT * FROM users LIMIT 5, 10;` (Skip 5, take 10).

slides.title: Backticks
slides.content:
# Quoting Identifiers `

MySQL uses backticks \` to quote table and column names (e.g., if you use reserved words).

`SELECT \`select\` FROM \`table\`;`

(Standard SQL uses double quotes " ).

slides.title: Engine Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which MySQL storage engine is the default and supports ACID transactions?

slides.title: Full-Text Search
slides.content:
# MATCH ... AGAINST üîé

Native full-text search capability.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
SELECT * FROM articles
WHERE MATCH(title, body)
AGAINST('database' IN NATURAL LANGUAGE MODE);
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Variables
slides.content:
# User Defined üì¶

Store values in session variables.

`SET @my_var = 100;`

`SELECT * FROM items WHERE price > @my_var;`

slides.title: INSERT IGNORE
slides.content:
# Silent Skip üîá

If a duplicate key error occurs, just skip the row instead of throwing an error.

`INSERT IGNORE INTO users ...`

slides.title: REPLACE INTO
slides.content:
# Upsert üîÑ

If a row works constraints (Primary Key), delete the old one and insert the new one.

`REPLACE INTO users (id, name) VALUES (1, 'Bob');`

slides.title: Group Concat
slides.content:
# List Aggregation üìù

Combine multiple row values into a single string.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
SELECT group_id, GROUP_CONCAT(name)
FROM students
GROUP BY group_id;
-- Result: "Alice,Bob,Charlie"
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Identifier Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which character does MySQL use to quote table and column names?

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: MySQL üê¨

The Popular Choice.

- **Engines:** InnoDB vs MyISAM.
- **Syntax:** Backticks, `LIMIT`.
- **Commands:** `SHOW TABLES`.
- **Features:** `AUTO_INCREMENT`.
